questions.question: What activity marked the beginning of settled life?
questions.answer: Agriculture

questions.question: Which practice helped humans grow food?
questions.answer: Farming

questions.question: What did humans start cultivating first?
questions.answer: Food grains

questions.question: Keeping animals for human use is called
questions.answer: Domestication

questions.question: Which animals were commonly domesticated?
questions.answer: Dogs and cattle

questions.question: Settled life led to the development of
questions.answer: Permanent shelters

questions.question: Which material was used to build early permanent houses?
questions.answer: Mud and wood

questions.question: Why did food production increase?
questions.answer: Agriculture

questions.question: What increased due to regular food supply?
questions.answer: Population

questions.question: Which activity became main occupation?
questions.answer: Farming

questions.question: What was stored for future use?
questions.answer: Food grains

questions.question: Which tools helped in agriculture?
questions.answer: Stone tools

questions.question: Settled life helped humans to develop
questions.answer: Culture

questions.question: What led to exchange of goods?
questions.answer: Trade

questions.question: Which structure stored grains?
questions.answer: Granaries

questions.question: What activity marked the beginning of settled life?
questions.answer: Agriculture

questions.question: Which practice helped humans grow food?
questions.answer: Farming

questions.question: What did humans start cultivating first?
questions.answer: Food grains

questions.question: Keeping animals for human use is called
questions.answer: Domestication

questions.question: Which animals were commonly domesticated?
questions.answer: Dogs and cattle

questions.question: What is settled life?
questions.answer: Settled life means living permanently in one place.

questions.question: What led to the beginning of settled life?
questions.answer: Agriculture led to the beginning of settled life.

questions.question: Why did humans start farming?
questions.answer: To ensure regular supply of food.

questions.question: What is agriculture?
questions.answer: Agriculture is the practice of growing crops.

questions.question: Which crops were grown early?
questions.answer: Food grains were grown early.

questions.question: What is domestication of animals?
questions.answer: Taming animals for human use is domestication.

questions.question: Name two domesticated animals.
questions.answer: Dogs and cattle are domesticated animals.

questions.question: Why did people store food?
questions.answer: To use food during scarcity.

questions.question: What is a granary?
questions.answer: A granary is a place to store grains.

questions.question: How did settled life affect population?
questions.answer: Population increased due to regular food supply.

questions.question: What materials were used for houses?
questions.answer: Mud, wood and grass were used.

questions.question: What was the main occupation of settled people?
questions.answer: Farming was the main occupation.

questions.question: Why did villages grow?
questions.answer: Because people lived permanently and population increased.

questions.question: How did trade begin?
questions.answer: People exchanged extra goods with others.

questions.question: What is barter system?
questions.answer: Exchange of goods without money is barter system.

questions.question: How did settled life improve safety?
questions.answer: People lived together and protected each other.

questions.question: What changes came in human lifestyle?
questions.answer: Life became organized and secure.

questions.question: Why were tools important in farming?
questions.answer: They made farming easier and faster.

questions.question: What was the role of animals in farming?
questions.answer: Animals helped in ploughing fields.

questions.question: How did settled life help culture?
questions.answer: It led to development of customs and traditions.
